newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: THURSDAY FORUM TO FOCUS ON FOREIGN INVESTMENT.
newsitem.headline: THURSDAY FORUM TO FOCUS ON FOREIGN INVESTMENT.

text.p: The Lithuanian Investment Agency (LIA) said on Tuesday that it was an organising an investors' forum for Thursday which would focus on the country's business and economic environment.
"Major foreign investors, prospective investors and members of the diplomatic corps will meet with (Prime Minister) Gediminas Vagnorius, and with key ministers," the agency said in a statement.
"The Prime Minister will outline the government's objectives and policies regarding the development and attraction of foreign investment in Lithuania," the statement added.
Vagnorius' government has committed itself to attracting higher levels of foreign investment and completing the privatisation process launched during his first term in office in 1991-1992.
Clients who want further information can contact Thomas Wilbur, the director of the LIA's investor and public relations department, at +370 2 62 74 38.
